sections.content: Lighting makes or breaks video quality. Elgato Key Light offers premium panel lighting with app control, while ring lights provide affordable, flattering illumination. Both have their place—here's how to decide.

content.title: App Control
content.description: Adjust brightness and temperature from phone. Stream Deck integration.

content.title: Diffused Light
content.description: Soft, even illumination without harsh shadows.

content.title: Smart Home Ready
content.description: WiFi connected, integrates with streaming setups.

content.title: Budget Friendly
content.description: Quality lighting under $50 possible. Great value.

content.title: Catchlight Effect
content.description: Distinctive ring reflection in eyes. Popular for beauty content.

content.title: Phone Mount
content.description: Many include phone holders. All-in-one solution.

faq.question: Is Elgato Key Light worth $180+?
faq.answer: For serious streamers, yes. App control, consistent quality, and integration make it worthwhile. Casual creators can get good results with cheaper options.

faq.question: Do ring lights look professional?
faq.answer: They can. Quality ring lights produce excellent results. The distinctive catchlight is preference—some love it, others prefer natural light reflections.

faq.question: Can I use both together?
faq.answer: Yes. Ring light as fill, Key Light as key. Or Key Light pair for main lighting. Combining lights gives more control.

faq.question: What size ring light is best?
faq.answer: 18-inch for full face coverage. 12-inch works for close-ups. Bigger ring = softer, more flattering light.
